==Japanese==
{{wikipedia|Hitachi}}
{{ja-kanjitab|日|立}}

===Etymology 1===
Noun stem of verb {{m|ja|日立つ|tr=hidatsu}}, itself a compound of {{compound|lang=ja|sort=ひだち|日|tr1=hi|t1=sun, day|立つ|tr2=tatsu|t2=stand; pass (as in time); depart, go away}}. {{rendaku2|sort=ひだち|tatsu|datsu}}

Sometimes spelled {{m|ja|肥立}}, replacing {{m|ja|日|tr=hi|pos={{l|ja|sc=Latn|訓読み|kun'yomi}}||day}} with {{m|ja|肥|tr=hi|pos={{l|ja|sc=Latn|音読み|on'yomi}}||manure}}.

====Pronunciation====
* {{l|ja|sc=Latn|訓読み|Kun'yomi}}
* {{IPA|lang=ja|[çida̠t͡ɕi]}}

====Alternative forms====
* {{l|ja|日立ち}}, {{l|ja|肥立ち}}, {{l|ja|肥立}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|ひだち}}

# [[growth]] as the days pass
# [[physical]] [[recovery]] day by day from an [[illness]] or after [[childbirth]]

=====Usage notes=====
The alternate forms {{l|ja|肥立ち}} and {{l|ja|肥立}} are generally reserved for the latter sense of ''[[physical]] [[recovery]]'', possibly from the sense of "manure going away" leading to "feeling better".

===Etymology 2===
The name of various places, titles, and companies in Japan.

====Pronunciation====
* {{l|ja|sc=Latn|訓読み|Kun'yomi}}
* {{IPA|lang=ja|[çita̠t͡ɕi]}}

====Proper noun====
{{ja-pos|proper|ひたち}}

# [[Hitachi]], a Japanese company
# {{w|Hitachi, Ibaraki|Hitachi}}, a city in {{w|Ibaraki prefecture}}
# {{w|Hitachi Province}}, a former region in Japan, roughly equivalent to modern-day {{w|Ibaraki prefecture}}
# an [[imperial]] [[title]], granted to {{w|Prince Hitachi}} and {{w|Princess Hitachi}}
